trans-unit.source: Python web app with Django | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Python web app with Django | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: A tutorial that teaches you how to host a Django-based website on Azure using a Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: A tutorial that teaches you how to host a Django-based website on Azure using a Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Django Hello World web application
trans-unit.target: Django Hello World web application

trans-unit.source: Windows
trans-unit.target: Windows

trans-unit.source: Mac/Linux
trans-unit.target: Mac/Linux

trans-unit.source: This tutorial describes how to host a Django-based website on Microsoft
trans-unit.target: This tutorial describes how to host a Django-based website on Microsoft

trans-unit.source: Azure using a Windows Server virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Azure using a Windows Server virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial assumes you have no prior experience using Azure.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial assumes you have no prior experience using Azure.

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, you will have a Django-based application up and running in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, you will have a Django-based application up and running in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: You will learn how to:
trans-unit.target: You will learn how to:

trans-unit.source: Set up an Azure virtual machine to host Django.
trans-unit.target: Set up an Azure virtual machine to host Django.

trans-unit.source: While this tutorial explains how to accomplish this under Windows Server, the same could also be done with a Linux VM hosted in Azure.
trans-unit.target: While this tutorial explains how to accomplish this under Windows Server, the same could also be done with a Linux VM hosted in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Django application from Windows.
trans-unit.target: Create a new Django application from Windows.

trans-unit.source: By following this tutorial, you will build a simple Hello World web
trans-unit.target: By following this tutorial, you will build a simple Hello World web

trans-unit.source: application.
trans-unit.target: application.

trans-unit.source: The application will be hosted in an Azure virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The application will be hosted in an Azure virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: A screenshot of the completed application appears next.
trans-unit.target: A screenshot of the completed application appears next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>A browser window displaying the hello world page on Azure</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>A browser window displaying the hello world page on Azure</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Creating and configuring an Azure virtual machine to host Django
trans-unit.target: Creating and configuring an Azure virtual machine to host Django

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions given <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link> to create an Azure virtual machine of the Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter distribution.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions given <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link> to create an Azure virtual machine of the Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter distribution.

trans-unit.source: Instruct Azure to direct port 80 traffic from the web to port 80 on the virtual machine:
trans-unit.target: Instruct Azure to direct port 80 traffic from the web to port 80 on the virtual machine:

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your newly created virtual machine in the Azure Portal and click the ENDPOINTS tab.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your newly created virtual machine in the Azure Portal and click the ENDPOINTS tab.

trans-unit.source: Click the ADD button at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Click the ADD button at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>add endpoint</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>add endpoint</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Open up the TCP protocol's PUBLIC PORT 80 as PRIVATE PORT 80.
trans-unit.target: Open up the TCP protocol's PUBLIC PORT 80 as PRIVATE PORT 80.

trans-unit.source: From the DASHBOARD tab, click CONNECT to use Remote Desktop to remotely log into the newly created Azure virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: From the DASHBOARD tab, click CONNECT to use Remote Desktop to remotely log into the newly created Azure virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Important Note: All instructions below assume you logged into the virtual machine correctly and are issuing commands there rather than your local machine.
trans-unit.target: Important Note: All instructions below assume you logged into the virtual machine correctly and are issuing commands there rather than your local machine.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Installing Python, Django, WFastCGI
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Installing Python, Django, WFastCGI

trans-unit.source: Note: In order to download using Internet Explorer you may have to configure IE ESC settings (Start/Administrative Tools/Server Manager/Local Server, then click IE Enhanced Security Configuration, set to Off).
trans-unit.target: Note: In order to download using Internet Explorer you may have to configure IE ESC settings (Start/Administrative Tools/Server Manager/Local Server, then click IE Enhanced Security Configuration, set to Off).

trans-unit.source: Install the latest Python 2.7 or 3.4 from <link><linkText>python.org[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Install the latest Python 2.7 or 3.4 from <link><linkText>python.org[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Install the wfastcgi and django packages using pip.
trans-unit.target: Install the wfastcgi and django packages using pip.

trans-unit.target: From C:\inetpub\wwwroot, enter the following command to create a new Django project:

trans-unit.source: The django-admin command generates a basic structure for Django-based websites:
trans-unit.target: The django-admin command generates a basic structure for Django-based websites:

trans-unit.source: helloworld\manage.py helps you to start hosting and stop hosting your Django-based website
trans-unit.target: helloworld\manage.py helps you to start hosting and stop hosting your Django-based website

trans-unit.source: helloworld\helloworld\settings.py contains Django settings for your application.
trans-unit.target: helloworld\helloworld\settings.py contains Django settings for your application.

trans-unit.source: helloworld\helloworld\urls.py contains the mapping code between each url and its view.
trans-unit.target: helloworld\helloworld\urls.py contains the mapping code between each url and its view.

trans-unit.source: Create a new file named views.py in the C:\inetpub\wwwroot\helloworld\helloworld directory.
trans-unit.target: Create a new file named views.py in the C:\inetpub\wwwroot\helloworld\helloworld directory.

trans-unit.source: This will contain the view that renders the "hello world" page.
trans-unit.target: This will contain the view that renders the "hello world" page.

trans-unit.source: Start your editor and enter the following:
trans-unit.target: Start your editor and enter the following:

trans-unit.target: Replace the contents of the urls.py file with the following.

trans-unit.source: Configuring IIS
trans-unit.target: Configuring IIS

trans-unit.source: Unlock the handlers section in the global applicationhost.config.
trans-unit.target: Unlock the handlers section in the global applicationhost.config.

trans-unit.source: This will enable the use of the python handler in your web.config.
trans-unit.target: This will enable the use of the python handler in your web.config.

trans-unit.source: Enable WFastCGI.
trans-unit.target: Enable WFastCGI.

trans-unit.source: This will add an application to the global applicationhost.config that refers to your Python interpreter executable and the wfastcgi.py script.
trans-unit.target: This will add an application to the global applicationhost.config that refers to your Python interpreter executable and the wfastcgi.py script.

trans-unit.source: Python 2.7:
trans-unit.target: Python 2.7:

trans-unit.source: Python 3.4:
trans-unit.target: Python 3.4:

trans-unit.source: Create a web.config file in C:\inetpub\wwwroot\helloworld.
trans-unit.target: Create a web.config file in C:\inetpub\wwwroot\helloworld.

trans-unit.source: The value of the scriptProcessor attribute should match the output of the previous step.
trans-unit.target: The value of the scriptProcessor attribute should match the output of the previous step.

trans-unit.source: See the page for <link><linkText>wfastcgi[]</linkText><title></title></link> on pypi for more on wfastcgi settings.
trans-unit.target: See the page for <link><linkText>wfastcgi[]</linkText><title></title></link> on pypi for more on wfastcgi settings.

trans-unit.source: Python 2.7:
trans-unit.target: Python 2.7:

trans-unit.source: Python 3.4:
trans-unit.target: Python 3.4:

trans-unit.source: Update the location of the IIS Default Web Site to point to the django project folder.
trans-unit.target: Update the location of the IIS Default Web Site to point to the django project folder.

trans-unit.source: Finally, load the web page in your browser.
trans-unit.target: Finally, load the web page in your browser.

trans-unit.target: <linkText>A browser window displaying the hello world page on Azure</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Shutting down your Azure virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Shutting down your Azure virtual machine

trans-unit.source: When you're done with this tutorial, shut down and/or remove your newly created Azure virtual machine to free up resources for other tutorials and avoid incurring Azure usage charges.
trans-unit.target: When you're done with this tutorial, shut down and/or remove your newly created Azure virtual machine to free up resources for other tutorials and avoid incurring Azure usage charges.
